text: Gus Promotes Religious Freedom Worldwide
label: HH1

text: On Thursday, Gus addressed a forum to highlight the treatment of Coptic Christians in Egypt,
label: TITLE

text: and promote religious freedom in the Middle East and worldwide.
label: BODY

text: As a Greek Orthodox Christian, Gus has made it a feature of his service in Congress to be a
label: BODY

text: voice for all religious minorities wherever they may be persecuted in the world. He led an effort
label: BODY

text: in 2011 to prevent the Egyptian military from using U.S. taxpayer dollars to persecute and attack
label: BODY

text: thousands of Coptic Christians and other religious minorities.
label: BODY

text: Watch Gus' speech here:
label: BODY

text: Remarks as prepared for delivery:
label: BODY

text: Good morning and thank you for allowing me to speak. Before I begin, I want to take a moment
label: BODY

text: to remember His Holiness Pope Shenouda. He was instrumental in the search for mutual
label: BODY

text: understanding among the world's religions. I express my deepest condolences for your loss and
label: BODY

text: pray that a worthy successor will arise – a successor who will protect the oldest Christians in the
label: BODY

text: Middle East and prevent the persecution of religious minorities.
label: BODY

text: As you know I have worked to condemn violations of religious freedom throughout the world. As
label: BODY

text: a member of the Subcommittee on the Middle East and the International Religious Freedom
label: BODY

text: Caucus, I am alarmed especially at the dwindling number of Christians in the Middle East. A
label: BODY

text: good friend of mine, Caroline Glick, wrote in the Jerusalem Post a column on this very issue.
label: BODY

text: She noted that in Turkey, the Christian population has dwindled from 2 million at the end of
label: BODY

text: World War I to less than 100,000 today.
label: BODY

text: And, there are only about 1,200 Greek Orthodox Christians left in Constantinople – a place that
label: BODY

text: refuses to recognize the Ecumenical nature of our Patriarch Bartholomew. Additionally the
label: BODY

text: Theological School at Halki – a seminary to train Orthodox clergy - has been shut down for over
label: BODY

text: Gus Promotes Religious Freedom Worldwide
label: HH1

text: 40 years. This is unacceptable behavior by the Turkish government.
label: BODY

text: In Iraq a decade ago there were 800,000 Christians - today there are 150,000. In Iran prior to
label: BODY

text: the Islamic revolution, Iran's Christians were more or less free to practice their religion - today
label: BODY

text: they are executed. In Syria, four decades ago, Christians made up nearly half of the population.
label: BODY

text: Today 4% of Syrians are Christian and they are suffering currently during tragic times over
label: BODY

text: there. Please include them in your prayers. In Jordan, half a century ago, 18% of the population
label: BODY

text: was Christian. Today 2% of Jordanians are Christian. And, of course, we all know of the horrible
label: BODY

text: massacre and persecution of Egyptian Copts. I am sure you have seen it time again, just like I
label: BODY

text: have, the massacre of Christians in Tahrir Square and Maspero, as well as during holy events
label: BODY

text: such as Christmas Eve mass.
label: BODY

text: That is why organizations like Coptic Solidarity are so important to remind the world that as we
label: BODY

text: speak here today, Christians in the Middle East are dying or being displaced. We must hold
label: BODY

text: Middle Eastern governments accountable. The right to worship must be protected in the Middle
label: BODY

text: East, starting with Egypt, in order for a free and democratic society to flourish.
label: BODY

text: And Egypt must know that the United States strongly supports the safety of religious minorities.
label: BODY

text: Last year I called for conditions to be placed on the $1.3 billion in annual aid that we provide
label: BODY

text: Egypt. This money has been used by the Egyptian military to persecute and attack Coptic
label: BODY

text: Christians and other religious minorities and this is unacceptable. I will continue to call for these
label: BODY

text: conditions as long as the rights of minorities in Egypt are ignored. Egypt's new president and
label: BODY

text: new parliament must understand that the US is watching their actions and we will not turn a
label: BODY

text: blind eye to the persecution of religious minorities. We will also be watching as the Constitution
label: BODY

text: is written. I have expressed my support in the past for the proposed Bill of Rights that would
label: BODY

text: cement the rights of religious minorities in Egypt and I express it here again today. And I
label: BODY

text: promise that I will remain vigilant to the plight of the Coptic Christians as Egypt continues its
label: BODY

text: transition.
label: BODY

text: Moving forward, we must continue to work together to support the freedom of religion and
label: BODY

text: expression for all of Egypt. As I am sure you know, the spokesman to the newly elected
label: BODY

text: Egyptian president said that President Morsi would appoint a woman and a Coptic Christian to
label: BODY

text: be his co-vice presidents, a first in Egyptian history. Whether this will take place is yet to be
label: BODY

text: seen, but it does remind us that we must never lose hope that one day Coptic Christians will
label: BODY

text: enjoy equal citizenship in their native country of Egypt.
label: BODY
